byline.original: By ETHAN BRONNER and STEPHEN FARRELL
byline.contributor: Ethan Bronner reported from Ramallah, and Stephen Farrell from Gaza.

abstract: Israel releases names of first 477 Palestinian prisoners that it will exchange for Gilad Shalit, Israeli soldier held by militant faction of Hamas.
snippet: Israel released the names of the first Palestinian prisoners whom it will exchange for a soldier held by Hamas. Most have been convicted of manslaughter, attempted murder or intentionally causing death.
lead_paragraph: Israel released the names of the first Palestinian prisoners whom it will exchange for a soldier held by Hamas. Most have been convicted of manslaughter, attempted murder or intentionally causing death.

headline.main: Israel Releases Names of 477 Prisoners to Be Freed in Trade
headline.print_headline: Israel Names 477 to Go Free in Trade for Hamas-Held Soldier
headline.seo: Israel Names 477 to Go Free in Trade for Hamas-Held Soldier
